intro: Galphimia glauca, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its trifoliate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, with a distinctive mist-like appearance. Galphimia glauca is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
